decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers and supporting documents:
P2224-RES-ZZ-04-DR-A-3101 Rev C02 (Proposed Block Plan);
P2224-RES-ZZ-00-DR-A-3200 Rev C04 (Proposed Ground Floor Plan);
P2224-RES-ZZ-01-DR-A-3201 Rev C04 (Proposed First Floor Plan);
P2224-RES-ZZ-02-DR-A-3202 Rev C04 (Proposed Second Floor Plan);
P2224-RES-ZZ-03-DR-A-3203 Rev C04 (Proposed Third Floor Plan);
P2224-RES-ZZ-04-DR-A-3204 Rev C04 (Proposed Roof Plan);
P2224-RES-ZZ-ZZ-DR-A-3205 Rev C04 (Proposed Layout Plans);
P2224-RES-ZZ-ZZ-DR-A-3260 Rev C02 (Proposed Elevation Sheet 1);
P2224-RES-ZZ-ZZ-DR-A-3261 Rev C02 (Proposed Elevation Sheet 2);
P2224-RES-ZZ-ZZ-DR-A-3262 Rev C02 (Detailed Elevations);
P2224-RES-ZZ-ZZ-DR-A-3280 Rev C02 (Proposed Section AA & BB);
P2224-RES-ZZ-ZZ-DR-A-3281 Rev C02 (Proposed Section CC);
Daylight, Sunlight and Overshadowing Assessment, dated February 2024 (ref. PP2011/WR/DL/202209-AV);
Arboricultural Report, dated February 2023 (ref. 230221-PD-11);
Tree Survey (ref. 230221-P-10);
Supporting Document "Tree Schedule (BS5837)".
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall be in accordance with those described in the hereby approved drawings listed in condition 2.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with Policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft Local Plan (Regulation 19).

| Notwithstanding the approved drawings and supporting documents, details of hard and soft landscaping (including tree planting and green roofs), boundary treatments and bin storage shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, prior to commencement of the development (excluding site clearance, demolition and ground works). The approved details shall be laid out and planted prior to the occupation of the development. Any trees or plants which within 5 years of planting, die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased shall be replaced with others of the same size and species and in the same positions within the next planting season. The development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details and retained as such thereafter.

Reason: To ensure appropriate hard and soft landscaping and boundary treatments in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area, to ensure appropriately landscaped amenity space and public realm, in accordance with Policies D3, D4 and D8 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft Local Plan (Regulation 19).

| The site is within the worst mode aircraft 1-day noise contour predicted for 2016 (57dB). Before the development is commenced (excluding site clearance, demolition and ground works), details shall be submitted for approval by the Council in writing, for the sound insulation of the building envelope which will achieve the internal criteria for sensitive rooms, based on the aircraft noise contour spectrum specified in Section 6 Supplementary Planning Guidance 10. The details should also include the provision of alternative means of ventilation, as appropriate, in accordance with Authority's criteria. The works should be completed before occupation and permanently retained thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site, in accordance with Policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 3.5 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| Prior to commencement of the development (excluding site clearance, demolition and ground works), details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of an enhanced sound insulation value of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas, namely, bedrooms below/above kitchen/living/dining/bathroom of separate flat and of at least 10dB enhancement for the bedroom and studio flat with bedspace adjoin the communal main entrance. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 3.5 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| Prior to commencement of the development (excluding site clearance, demolition and ground works), details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of enhanced sound insulation of lifts and lift shafts, in accordance with noise limits specified in Table 5 BS8233:2014. Details shall include mitigation measures and the resulting sound insulation value and internal sound/rating level. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site, in accordance with Policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policies 3.5 and 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
| Control measures shall ensure that the following standards are implemented:
- noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
- dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
- lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
- hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays (no work on public holidays),
- neighbour liaison, notifications to interested parties and considerate complaints procedure,
- public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the work for the duration of the works in case of emergencies, enquiries or complaints.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with Policy D14 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).

| The rooflights of the hereby approved development shall not protrude more than 0.15 metres beyond the plane of the slope of the roof when measured from the perpendicular with the external surface of the roof and shall be retained as such for the lifetime of the development.

Reason: To ensure the development harmonises with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 19).
| No part of the flat roof(s) of the hereby approved development shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with Policies 7A and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and Policy DAA of Ealing's draft new Local Plan (Regulation 19).

| The cycle store identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved flats and shall be permanently retained for the lifetime of the development.
Reason: To provide adequate cycle storage facilities for future occupiers in accordance with Policy T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| The disabled parking identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved flats and shall be permanently retained for the lifetime of the development.
Reason: To provide adequate disabled parking in accordance with Policies D5, D7 and T6 of the London Plan (2021).
description: Construction of part three, part four storey detached building to accommodate 8 self-contained residential flats (Use Class C3) with provision of amenity space, car parking, cycle parking, refuse storage and landscaping (following demolition of existing dwellinghouse)
